item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, November 9, 2024 at 7:10 PM UTC
item.description:
1. OpenCoder: Open-Source LLM for Coding (70 points | 10 comments)
2. Windows Process Injection (26 points | discuss)
3. Jaws – a JavaScript to WASM ahead of time compiler (26 points | 11 comments)
4. Mergiraf: a syntax-aware merge driver for Git (258 points | 58 comments)
5. Show HN: HTML-to-Markdown – convert entire websites to Markdown with Golang/CLI (191 points | 39 comments)
6. Scientist treated her own cancer with viruses she grew in the lab (211 points | 90 comments)
7. Texture-Less Text Rendering (144 points | 40 comments)
8. SVDQuant: 4-Bit Quantization Powers 12B Flux on a 16GB 4090 GPU with 3x Speedup (125 points | 37 comments)
9. Trellis (YC W24) is hiring eng to turn documents into database ( | hide)
10. Memories are not only in the brain, human cell study finds (128 points | 52 comments)
11. The Saturn V FUELDRAULIC Gimbal System (1963) (27 points | 7 comments)
12. Obtainium: Get Android App Updates Directly from the Source (119 points | 60 comments)
13. Nikolai Fyodorov wanted to resurrect the dead to live among the stars (29 points | 11 comments)
14. HPV vaccination: How the world can eliminate cervical cancer (216 points | 89 comments)
15. Calculating at Pencil and Paper Scale (4 points | discuss)
16. Ticketmaster’s attempt to game arbitration services fails (172 points | 33 comments)
17. Since the '60s, Ford has stored cars underground in a Kansas City cave (89 points | 26 comments)
18. Can humans say the largest prime number before we find the next one? (248 points | 110 comments)
19. Notes on Guyana (74 points | 61 comments)
20. Using Two ReMarkables (58 points | 22 comments)
21. A CC-By Open-Source TTS Model with Voice Cloning (106 points | 20 comments)
22. Delta: A syntax-highlighting pager for Git, diff, grep, and blame output (524 points | 70 comments)
23. Segmenting Credit Card Customers with K-Means: A Fun Dive into Clustering (41 points | 23 comments)
24. Gravity's Eastern Voyage (29 points | 3 comments)
25. Iterative α-(de)blending and Stochastic Interpolants (17 points | 1 comment)
26. Mitochondria Are Alive (584 points | 368 comments)
27. Lynis – Security auditing and hardening tool, for Unix-based systems (33 points | 7 comments)
28. Algol-68 seemed like a good idea (63 points | 48 comments)
29. Making Electronic Calipers (162 points | 61 comments)
30. Reconstruction of Lomonosov's Discovery of Venus's Atmosphere (2012) [pdf] (29 points | 6 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, November 9, 2024 at 7:10 PM UTC
